intro: Pleuranthodium floccosum, commonly known as the woolly pleuranthodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
